Padapatha
a
patha,
rdfs:Class
rdfs:comment
One of the eleven Pathas, with a word by word recitation, marked by a conscious pause after every word, and after any special grammatical code embedded in the text; suppresses euphonic combination and restores each word in its original intended form.
rdfs:isDefinedBy
indo:
patha
a
rdfs:Class
rdfs:comment
Style to recite or chant a Vedic mantra in the oral tradition of the Vedas, enabling its memorization.
rdfs:isDefinedBy
indo:
rdfs:label
patha
,
Patha
and
pāṭha
skos:note
There are eleven Pathas, with increasing difficulty, divided in 3 simpler or natural, and 8 complex ones.
owl:oneOf
Samhitapatha
,
Padapatha
,
indo:Kramapatha
,
indo:Jatapatha
,
indo:Maalaapatha
,
indo:Sikhapatha
,
indo:Rekhapatha
,
indo:Dhwajapatha
,
indo:Dandapatha
,
indo:Rathaapatha
and
indo:Ghanapatha
rdfs:subClassOf
rdfs:Resource
Samhita
a
rdfs:Class,
Veda literature
rdfs:comment
One of the four text styles, and the oldest part, in a Veda, wherein text or verses are methodically put together.
rdfs:isDefinedBy

Samhitapatha
a
patha,
rdfs:Class
rdfs:comment
One of the eleven Pathas, with continuous recitation of Sanskrit words bound by the phonetic rules of euphonic combination.
rdfs:isDefinedBy
indo:
rdfs:label
